p: In a study ( Lai et al., 2020) of 1,257 HCW’s during the COVID-19 outbreak, high rates of depression, anxiety and insomnia were reported with over 70% reporting psychological distress. A survey ( Zhang et al., 2020a) of Chinese HCWs during the COVID-19 outbreak found that 36.1% (564 of 1,563) had symptoms of insomnia. A comparison of HCWs in Wuhan, the epicentre of the COVID-19 outbreak, compared to those in a different Chinese province found that staff in Wuhan had higher rates of insomnia and stress responses ( Li et al., 2020a). One study ( Chua et al., 2004) compared HCWs with healthy controls and found that HCWs were not more stressed than controls (342) but 89% (241 of 271) of HCWs experienced negative psychological symptoms.
